results.description:
Join us for this three hour Intro to Fashion Illustration Workshop with the exciting and talented Kitty N. Wong. Her work recently appeared in a five page spread in Elle Magazine, Hong Kong (see below). 

This workshop is divided into two sections...

Section 1: Pencil

Attendees will learn to draw figures for fashion using two different proportional systems. This section will also cover facial features to bring character to your work. 

Section 2: Watercolor

Attendees will learn how to color their work and bring their patterns and prints to life. This is a favorite part for many attendees.

Material Requirements: (please bring)

- Watercolor Brushes: Size 0,2 and 6 rounds 

- Pencils 2b and HB. A sharpener and an eraser. 

Paint, palettes, and paper will be provided.               ____________________________________________________

Kitty N. Wong clients include: Maybelline, Lane Crawford, Elle Hong Kong, Dazed Digital, Tiffany & Co., Nespresso, The National Post and Hong Kong Tatler.

This session takes place in the historic and elegant National Arts Club on Gramercy Park South.

If you have any questions please free to email me at simon (at) drawingnewyork.com and I will be happy to answer them. 

Thank you and we look forward to working with you!

Simon
results.name: Intro to Fashion Illustration Workshop with Kitty N. Wong!

results.description:
I walked into this newly opened restaurant in K-Town during a rare lunch excursion from the office.  The restaurant was recently opened and appears modern and clean.  The appetizers - ban chan - changes by the day and are fresh.  Dishes are large - I had the kimchi fried rice - and well prepared.  The restaurant is pricier than some restaurants on the street but a good experience.

 Not all dishes on the menu are spicy/hot.

If you'd like to join me for lunch please bring an appetite. 

(And don't forget cash to help sort the bill afterwards.)

It doesn't appear that they have weekend lunch specials.  Prices start at about $15 per dish.  

Five Senses Yelp Page

results.description:
Our next meetup will focus on: Knowledge.

The meetup runs as follows:


1) The moderator selects one subject for discussion and a date for the meeting. Subjects can be as ephemeral as "love," "god," and "purpose," or as grounded as "politics," "environmentalism," and "family."

2) At the meetup, people are encouraged to propose a question related to the subject. The moderator will collect all of the questions in a list. Questions may also be proposed ahead of time online on the event page.

3) The group will then vote on the questions. In the first round of voting, each individual may vote for as many questions as they like. The top three will then go to a second round, where each individual may vote just once.

4) The question with the most votes is then discussed. Often, the discussion starts with a narrowing of the question, as it can be challenging to devise a question that can possibly be answered by a small group in just a couple of hours' discussion.

Finally, please consider making a small donation to help the moderator cover subscription costs.
results.name: Let's Talk About: Knowledge

results.description:
Did you know that blogging was one of the first forms of social media? It's true. Back in the day, blogging was more or less an online journal that you could either share with other people... or keep private. It's like your starting a conversation with your reader. You write, and they comment. Today, blogging platforms are more or less personal or business websites with the social aspect still available to actively engage with readers. You can use blogging for many things:
- Therapy (working through things can be easier to release when we take the time to write them down)
- Instructional (Help other people by telling them how you do what you do)
- Make money (Yes it's true, you can earn money from your blog)

Mostly, I think people using blogging to let their voice be heard. Blogging is easy and everyone that wants to be part of the conversation can have a voice. You can speak without interruption and then wait for a reply. That is one of the greatest things about blogging in my opinion.... speaking without interruption. I feel like very often people don't really listen... they are sort of just waiting for their turn to talk. Unlike Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest (I love Pinterest) blogging provides us with a soap box to stand on and look for like minded people. Blogging can generate revenue and blogging can also provide your with a forum to provide evidence your expertise. So, I think I'd like to host a meetup at the Parsippany Library to show you how to setup your free blogging account and get your started.

Here's my intention:
-1 hour meetup (to start, if you like this we can do it again)
-We'll go over setting up your free blogging account
-learn how to create content
-learn how to modify the appearance
-learn how to share your blog (or not, your choice)
(believe me the hour will go very quickly)

There are two ways we can do this, I can either book the computer room (which only has 12 computers so there's a limit to the number of members that can sign up) OR I can book a regular meeting room that will have wifi and you will all be required to bring your own laptop. (actually I can bring a few spares, but I don't have enough for everyone) When you leave after this meetup, you will have a blog started, with at least one post! Writing is one of the best ways to understand how you think about what you think about. I am always amazed at some of the things that I write when I read them later, sometimes I see how I am blocking my success by the words I use, or by the way I talk about my possibilities... and sometimes I am blown away by my insight and I thinks, "Wow, did I really write that? That is good!" HA HA HA HA

One other thing, I have to pay to book the Library, so I will need to charge a small fee to set this up. RSVP if you're interested so I can keep you up to date on the exact time and place.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for A.I.M -> Upstairs Meeting Room
results.name: Do you want to learn how to start a popular blog?

We fence foil predominantly, but if you fence epee or saber, let me know and I'll bring mine.  It also helps if you leave a comment if you're going to the meetup and you'd like to fence epee or saber.


We will be charging $15 per meeting to cover the cost of renting the studio.  There is a significant discount for purchasing the entire semester which includes 14 2 hour classes.


We will do our best to provide instruction appropriate for each individuals skill level. 

We have some equipment to lend, but if you would like to borrow, please contact me at least 24 hours before the meetup, and let me know if you are left handed.


The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://maps.google.com/maps?q=380+broadway&hl=en&ll=40.718209,-74.002908&spn=0.006034,0.012703&sll=40.718109,-74.002904&layer=c&cbp=13,90.98,,1,-3.47&cbll=40.718122,-74.00297... ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

Beginners are welcome. Experienced fencers welcome. Everybody's welcome!

- Mike

results.description:
(IMPORTANT! If you are attending you also need to register here in addition to the normal meetup RSVP)!

Welcome Meteor developers! 


If you were with us on Meteor Day last year, you remember the excitement as we celebrated the release of Meteor 1.0. I'm thrilled to tell you that we’re planning on bringing the worldwide community together again this fall for a global distributed hackathon.


This distributed hackathon, taking place over the weekend of October 10th and 11th, will have chapters working out of our meetups all around the world, but you're also free to work from home or your favorite coffee shop with other developers from anywhere in the world.

It'll be a great chance to work with fellow Meteorites, share awesome apps, and communicate with other meetup groups about Meteor. Whether you're an experienced Meteor developer or just looking to get started, we hope you can join us.

Here's the agenda for this event:

Saturday Oct, 10

1:00 PM - Participants arrive and get set up

1:30 PM - People with ideas pitch the rest of the group to recruit members

2:00 PM - Hangout with other cities to discuss the projects you'll be working on

2:30 PM - Begin hacking 

Get some sleep; you'll program much better!

Sunday Oct, 11

1:00 PM - Organizer reminds people to finish testing and deploying

2:30 PM - End hacking ; attendees invited to record 1 minute videos

3:00 PM - Project local videos

3:30 PM - Invite participants to share their lessons learned, write blog posts, tweet etc... Discuss next meetup.

4:00 PM - Hit a nearby pub and celebrate!

If you want to participate but haven't had any luck finding a teammate yet, tweet your idea with #meteorteammate.


See the official hackathon page for more details.

results.description:
From my experience, the Sartrean idea of "bad faith" is generally  misconceived, consequently misemployed.

In my mind, it is a powerful idea that can effectively and efficiently serve and awaken humanity, and a lot of individuals, from cultural myopia and implicit bias/assumptions when critically and  constructively addressed in a continuous practice/manner.

Accordingly, I propose we read Sartre's essays on Bad Faith, found in chapter two of his magnum opus, "Being and Nothingness".  (less than 20 pages).

And then gather for an hour or so, to discuss it.

Here is a link to the essay : http://www.philosophymagazine.com/others/MO_Sartre_BadFaith.html#Chapter 3


MANDATORY READING ASSIGNMENT : Bad Faith essay

AUTHOR : Jean-Paul Sartre.

***** Feel free to conduct  and/or suggest any additional readings. *****
results.how_to_find_us: This is my cell. 917 613.9736
results.name: What is BAD FAITH ?   (Sartre's essay)

results.description:
Bokashi & Community Composting Opportunities To Recycle Food Waste and Grow Healthy Soil For Jersey City

Interested to learn more about Recycling Food Waste ?

THIS FREE EVENT WILL TAKE PLACE AS PART OF THE P.E.A.C.E. GARDEN AMARANTH 7 TOMATO FESTIVAL - MORE INFO HERE https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10153080669433093&set=a.495118473092.269013.549798092&type=1&theater

1pm - 1:45 Talk
1:45 - 2:30  Make Bokashi Starter


Special Guest Shig Matsukawa, Bokashi Master and SJC's lead educator for our Community Composting initiative, will be joining us to discuss Traditional Composting and the Bokashi fermentation approach to recycling your food waste. You will learn ways to integrate the Bokashi high potency, microbe rich resource into your traditional composting systems / garden landscapes and backyards + you will learn insightful lessons on the importance of healthy microbes and their role they play in our lives.  High doses of good microbes can heal landscapes and waterways and are needed to grow healthy soil, which we need more of in eco-challenged urban environments like Jersey City.

AND . . .  WORMS love Bokashi, reproducing at 5-6X their usual rate !!

Home, Community & Schools Gardeners welcome - get your questions answered about this low labor process and join the growing ranks of Jersey City's Food Scrappers !

SJC has initiated a Bokashi Garden Exchange program at partner site P.E.A.C.E. Community Garden, which we are looking to expand - YES! we need more gardens in the network.

Bucket Kits and Starter will be on sale and if we run out we're taking orders !


More information can be found here - http://sustainablejc.org/wordpress/projects/community-composting/


<a href="http://sustainablejc.org/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/Culinary-Conf-Center-logo.gif"></a>

results.description:
This years marks the 50th anniversary of NYC's first landmarks law which set the stage for the protection and preservation of the city's beautiful and historic neighborhoods.   This guided tour will celebrate the communities of Fort Greene and Clinton Hill and cover some of Brooklyn's colorful history.  By the time we are finished you will know why local residents love their neighborhood! 

Before there was Carnegie Hall in Manhattan (1891), there was the Brooklyn Academy of Music (1861) and this is where we'll begin our Meetup at the very unique BAM Cafe inside. The Brooklyn Academy (BAM) is one of NYC's great places for movies, music, dance and theater. This is where Nureyev's first American performance took place and also the site of opera star Enrico Caruso's last concert.  Over the year's BAM has hosted live performances from Isadora Duncan, Sarah Bernhardt, Paul Simon, Laurie Anderson, the Royal Shakespeare Company and Sufjan Stevens to name a few.


The Fort Greene and Clinton Hill neighborhoods contain some of New York's most beautiful and historic residential streets - filled with architectural treasures includes lovely townhouses, magnificent churches, mansions, along with the prestigious Pratt Institute and campus with its fascinating collection of outdoor art and sculpture.  


We'll end our walk at Brooklyn's first park, Fort Greene Park where we'll visit a unique Revolutionary War monument to the 11,000 Americans who died nearby in the East River while on British prison ships.  Afterwards we'll enjoy optional socializing and/or checking out the park's artisans and farmer's markets.  Or perhaps to head over to a local beer garden to celebrate the day! Plenty of restaurants nearby!


Practicalities:  Please try and take care of business beforehand: there should be restrooms inside the Brooklyn Academy of Music at our starting point. We'll be walking a good three miles so you may want to have a meal beforehand or bring a snack or sandwich.  

Cheers!

Hank

[masked]
results.name: Exploring Fort Greene & Clinton Hill

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
Confronted with problems and inadequacies in our life, and in our relationships, we often blame others for their selfishness or insensitivity, or we might lament our bad luck for a failure or a loss. We often rely on analyzing what is apparent, tangible, limited, or, in other words, perceptible by our senses and intellect to find a solution to our perceived problems, often resulting in a solution that creates more problems.

And yet, could we not reorient our attention away from external objects toward the presence of the spiritual within us in order to find more appropriate solutions to our questions?

In this afternoon's discussion, we will analyze the construct of this double aspect of our being - the tangible and intangible - and share instances of our own experience when we relied on the spiritual rather than the physical to direct our behavior.

We will also explore a few specific techniques such as the use of intuition and creative visualization that create habits within us of aligning ourselves with the greater invisible dimension of our double nature to give purpose and satisfaction to our life.

The facilitator of this afternoon's discussion, Alex Bastien, is a long time member of the Rosicrucian Order AMORC, who finds great joy in the persistent contemplation and practice of the teachings of the Order and in sharing his current understanding of the principles. What he values most about the Order is its non-dogmatic character - you verify for yourself the ideas that are offered.

As with all the programs at the Rosicrucian Cultural Center, there is no charge for any of our programs and we happily accept donations!
results.name: Finding Solutions in the Spiritual Aspect of our Being

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

http://walmart.com/ip/30224763%3Fwmlspartner%3Dwlpa%26selectedSellerId%3D58%26adid%3D22222222227022634408%26wl0%3D%26wl1%3Dg%26wl2%3Dc%26wl3%3D40471765112%26wl4%3D%26wl5%3Dpla%26wl6%3D78363399392%26veh%3Dsem&cad=rja">http://www.google.com/aclk?sa=l&ai=CbT7Qq1BnVanSCc2ApgOT6oD4A5iQss0GiKiB6ZYB4KnK9qMCCAQQAigFYMnGqYvApNgPoAGYyIbYA8gBB6oEJE_QPn_0wVfREaUxHF1zc8Vdfo8WxmTOJWfipIg-LyMa3y2oksAFBaAGJoAH0Lf5J5AHAagHpr4bqAeTwhuoB5TCG9gHAeAS5-ns16yHhuO6AQ&sig=AOD64_2QJ7_R8fCKsWI8tsjMXDJKklwB7w&ctype=5&rct=j&q=&ved=0CCgQwg8&adurl=http://walmart.com/ip/30224763%3Fwmlspartner%3Dwlpa%26selectedSellerId%3D58%26adid%3D22222222227022634408%26wl0%3D%26wl1%3Dg%26wl2%3Dc%26wl3%3D40471765112%26wl4%3D%26wl5%3Dpla%26wl6%3D78363399392%26veh%3Dsem&cad=rja

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Please join APEN for a moderated panel discussion that celebrates Albanian leaders in the technology field. These accomplished individuals will share their insight on their experience in the tech and start up fields. Additionally, we will welcome and host recruiters from various New York City tech companies. Saturday, October 10th, 2015, 1:00pm-5:00pm 

See who is going:

https://www.facebook.com/events/980143992044858/

Faculty House at Columbia University
64 Morningside Drive
New York, NY, 10027
Light refreshments will be served. Order tickets via Eventbrite:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/expanding-horizons-apen-tech-event-2015-tickets-18832583765?aff=efbevent

Ticket sales help APEN cover the cost of hosting events that help inspire the next generation of Albanian leaders. Donations are welcome.

results.how_to_find_us: www.dwwac.com
results.name: Health Awareness Meeting-Doterra

results.description:
75+ members once again attended our last Scavenger Hunt! 

The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package. This hunt will also celebrate Comic Con.

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Oct-10-2015_at_0130PM

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets here ASAP - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Oct-10-2015_at_0130PM
results.name: The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package. This hunt will also celebrate Comic Con.

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Oct-10-2015_at_0130PM

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets here ASAP - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Oct-10-2015_at_0130PM

results.description:
The NYSC invites you to join us to our monthly Women’s circle where we honor your feelings, honor your soul and call upon your divine being to help you move through this sacred time. Within the circle, women unite to empower their voices, enhance their courage, reinforce their compassion, and connect with their wisdom. We meditate, play music to access our heart's knowledge, remember our mothers and grandmas, share, and enjoy sisterhood! This circle is open to all traditions and levels, and beginners are especially encouraged to attend.
Please arrive on time and bring water to drink, a drum or rattle (you may borrow one at the event), pen & notepad, a scarf, and feel free to bring objects that are connected to your spiritual power. Suggested donation: $20 For more info visit http://www.nyshamaniccircle.org/womens-circle or email [masked] with questions.

If you need to contact us on Saturday, please feel free to call Karen at 201/[masked] or Cristina at 201/[masked]

"When women gather, Pachamama heals!"
results.name: NYSC Women's Circle!

venue.address_1: Tillary St and Cadman Plaza W
venue.name: Cadman Plaza (Turf Fields)

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME 90 mins SAT 1:30 PM Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

results.description:

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

I will schedule this walk again on a weekend and possibly on a weekday.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

Description: On this walking tour, we will discuss women architects, artists, designers, journalists, models, sculptors, and socialites from the late 19th century to the early 20th century. Along the way, we'll talk about the battle for the top socialite of New York City; the "Tiffany Girls" rediscovered; the "sob sisters" sentimental appeal; architectural details with a feminine touch; the sculptress labeled the "poor little rich girl"; and artist models whose face and figure we still see all around NYC.

This is a walking tour with much commentary. We'll be walking about 2 1/2 miles. We will be walking through the northern section of Midtown and the Upper East Side. There will be plenty of stopping at points of interest. If you don't like a lot of stopping, then this type of walk is not good for you. The tour lasts about 2 hours and 15 minutes.

Below was Mrs. F.M. Cossitt, the first woman to ride a bicycle in New York (Source MCNY [Unidentified photographer, circa 1888])

Below is from The New York Times, June 15, 1895

Below was a self-portrait of Francis Benjamin Johnston. She was dressed as a man in bicycle attire, sporting a false moustache and holding a bicycle, circa 1890. (Source Library of Congress) Photographer Francis Benjamin Johnston was one of the earliest American female photographers and became the official photographer for several presidential administrations in the late 19th century and early 20th century.

Below is an illustration from Puck Magazine. (Source Library of Congress [Frederick Burr Opper, June 19, 1895)

Below is from The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, January 17, 1922

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM. The meeting place is outside of the front entrance to the Time Warner Center, which is at 10 Columbus Circle at 59th Street and Broadway. Before the walk, restrooms are available on the south and north sides of the 2nd and 3rd floors at Time Warner Center.

Below is outside of the front entrance to Time Warner Center at Columbus Circle.

Transportation Options: Take the A, B, C, D, or 1 subway train to 59th Street Street and Columbus Circle.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish at about 4:35 PM on the Upper East Side at East 66th Street and Lexington Avenue. 

Rainy weather cancels this walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post the cancellation notice in the Discussion Board.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Below was Alva Vanderbilt at her fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883]) Photographer Jose Maria Mora was able to mingle easily with the upper classes of New York City and became the photographer of choice for the constant fancy-dress balls, tableaux, and other events of this era that required the upper class to get dressed up…which they did amazingly often.

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

Below was Mrs. Seward Webb at Alva Vanderbilt's fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883])

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

Below was Miss Bessie Webb at Alva Vanderbilt's fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883])

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

results.description:
In this first meeting, we'll introduce ourselves, and talk about how to do this book as part of a group.


If you can get the book before Saturday, that would be awesome, if not, we won't actually start discussing the real contents of the book until our second meet-up. We will be referencing the part of the book that tells you how to go through this book as a group.


The chapters are:

1: Preparing For Love - includes: Expanding Our Capacity to Love & be Loved, Honoring Our Need For Others, Making Space for Love


2: Completions- includes: Letting Go of the Past, Releasing Toxic Ties, Relinquishing Unconscious Patterns

3: Healing Core Wounds- includes: Core Beliefs, Transforming an Identity, Healing the Hungry Heart, Reclaiming the Disowned Self, Release Ceremony


4: Setting Your Course- includes: Setting an Intention, Clarifying Your Soul's Purpose, Receiving Inner Guidance, Making Wise Choices


5: First Things First- includes: The Art of Receiving, Om Making Commitments, On Developing Emotional Literacy


6: A Life Worth Living- includes: On being Happy, Listening with an Open Heart, On Speaking Up


7: Living Love Fulfilled- includes: The Enchanted Life, From "Me" to "We", On Being a "Yes" to Love


We'll take a week break for Thanksgiving.


The first meet up will be at the diner on the corner of 12th St & Greenwhich Ave, one block from the 1,2 & 3 train - 14th St. Stop.


This first two or three meetings will be open to anyone, but after that we'll have it be just us - with us being whoever has attended the first 2-3 meetings and wants to continue on to the end of the book.

This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

***Please note***

- Please give me your email address and phone number right after RSVP then we will send you an invoice from Paypal when we can pay through that.

-Class will start at 3pm so please don't be late. please be in the class at least 10minutes early.

Have you heard about Bibimbab Burger? 

I am sure lots of Korean Food Lovers know Bibimbab which is a signature Korean dish now. it means "mixed rice" and  it's  served as a bowl of warm white rice topped with namul (sautéed and seasoned vegetables) and gochujang (chili pepper paste), soy sauce, or doenjang, a salty soybean paste.

Now we will make this Bibimbab as a burger.

You don't understand? haha

Chef 'Angelo Sosa' from a restaurant called 'Social Eatz', he won at the Greatest Burger in America Competition with this Bibimbab Burger. 

I went to Social Eatz and tried it. now i want to share this burger with you because then it will help you to understand Korean Food better and plus you can eat it often even you don't know much of Korean Food. 

Angelo Sosa never tells me his recipe of course(haha), so i will make my own recipe and share everyone. 

This is not 100% Korean Food but like i said, i will cook with you guys if this menu helps you to know about Korean Food easier. ^^

Are you excited? well, I am!
results.name: Have you tried Bibimbab Burger?

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.description:
This past Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 19 women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking…


Let’s get together and give to the homeless. You can give money or food or clothes or whatever you want to give. While we're at it, we'll hold doors for people and be nice to tourists and be extra polite to everyone and smile and be happy. I dunno about you, but I'm already smiling. =)


Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 

What to bring? You should bring 10 or 20 dollars in singles or if you don't want to give cash then make a couple of sandwiches to hand out or some socks or buy a pack or two of clean underwear, etc. Toiletries are good (ziplock bags with a travel toothbrush, toothpaste, etc). Travel packs of baby wipes are good and so on. If you want to pick up $1 slices of pizza as we walk and hand them out, that would be great. Give what you want, but please don't come empty-handed. We will give until we run out of things to give.

After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed. 

$0 - This is a free event hosted by Date Walking

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
Hey Inconsistent Creatives!

I started this group because I was inspired by the idea of EMBRACING my own inconsistency instead of demonizing it.

aka Screw the rules! I don't HAVE to be consistent in my creativity!

Through speaking with many of you, I found that we're all in a similar place (frustrated by the rules) and we're all looking for answers. 

I've been doing a ton of work on this in my own life and lots of research.

I've discovered that inconsistency is a symptom of something else entirely. Get to the bottom of that, and things can start to shift and change.

I'm offering a paid online workshop for anyone who wants to come and get a ton of value for themselves and move their project(s) forward. All the details are here on my site: http://michelleakin.nyc/screwtherules

As you can see, I created this with all of you in mind, and I hope to see you there!

If you can't make it live, you can still sign up to receive a recording.

Alternatively, I'm also offering private "Screw the Rules" coaching sessions, which you can contact me directly if you are interested in hearing more about.
results.name: Screw the Rules! - Live Online Workshop

results.description:
Hope all is well SiSTARS! Our first meetup went well. We talked about the zodiac signs, their characteristics, evolved and devolved traits, and their opposite signs. We ended up staying an extra hour, and went to out to eat after!

Our next meetup in October, will focus on the Astrological Houses. Feel free to bring any books or materials for reference.
results.name: 2nd CMA Meetup - Houses

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

venue.name: Jeffrey Deitch Gallery

results.description:
An exhibit of art by Marjorie Cameron (Usually known simply as Cameron).


Artist, performer, poet, and occult practitioner, Cameron (Marjorie Cameron Parsons Kimmel) [masked]) is one of the most fascinating underground figures of mid century California. A maverick follower of the esoteric mysticism of Aleister Crowley and his philosophical group, the O.T.O. (Ordo Ternpli Orientis), Cameron was also an accomplished painter and draftsman and mentor to younger artists and poets such as Wallace Berman, George Herms, David Meltzer, and Aya.

Cameron's works demonstrate refined draughtsmanship, formal command, and fantastic imaginative powers. Her sensitive drawings and paintings delineate a magical realm, of metamorphosis and protean transformation.

This will be a joint event with the Aiwass Study group, so it won't be women only. You are welcome to bring friends.


CAMERON - Cinderella of the Wastelands


Deitch Projects Gallery 


http://deitch.nyc/

no admission fee for the gallery.


After we see the show, I suggest that we go to a nearby coffee shop for a break, and then go to the Ritual of the Lamp of Invisible Light, a beautiful ritual with the purpose of spreading spiritual Light; including group participation with a middle pillar visualization and chanting.

6:00 pm.
At Altered Stages, 212 W 29th St., 3rd Floor
http://www.meetup.com/lampofinvisiblelight/events/225030314/

We go out to dinner after the ritual.

You are welcome to come only to the gallery, or meet us at the ritual, or go to everything! It will be a great day!
results.name: CAMERON - Artist and Magician

results.description:
Stop dwelling on the shoulda, coulda, wouldas! 

Turn your fear into fuel. 

Your business is priority...not a plan B. Learn how to sharpen your business skills, one goal at a time, with Danielle Fairbairn-Bland of the Vision Transformation Firm. Learn how to: 

• Maximize your business potential 

• Create a tool to document your milestones

• Manage your expectations and hold yourself accountable 

Who's fired up to think-out-the-box...be your own boss...surround yourself with positive people?  Make connections and feel inspired!
results.name: Time for Action!

venue.name: In front of National Museum of American Indian

results.description:
Hey hey Urban Explorers!

The seasons are changing and we need to take full advantage of the weather before we turn into SideStreet Snowball Fight Tours... just kidding, but maybe?


Starting at the southern tip of the island, we'll touch upon its earliest days when Manhattan was a Dutch trading post named New Amsterdam.  It's a riveting tale of wealth, revolution, and unprecedented growth. From it's earliest days New Amsterdam bred a culturally diverse population with their eyes set on making it big. 

We'll take the side-streets past some of the cities oldest architecture and most important sites as we trace the transition from tiny trading post to the world's most famous city. Our walk will end at the South Street Seaport which is packed with beauty, intrigue, and most importantly - tons of great food and beverages. 

WHO SHOULD COME TO THIS EVENT :

To put it simply : everyone, duh! But if you appreciate good conversation, little known facts about the city around you, and great people - this is DEFINITELY for you.

WHY SHOULD I COME TO THIS EVENT:

To meet great people, learn facts to impress your friends, get exercise, enjoy life, turn off Netflix, and appreciate the city in a different light. 

HOW LONG DOES THE TOUR LAST:

2 hours is a fair estimate. Depending on our pace and conversation it may last a little longer. 

HOW DO I GET TO THE STARTING POINT: 

I would suggest taking the 4, 5  to Bowling Green. The R to Whitehall Street will leave you right around the corner. 

HOW MUCH DOES IT COST: 

I typically charge $20 a tour through my business, SideStreet Tours, but this one is on the house. If you had an awesome time and wish to offer a gratuity at the end, it's always much appreciated. 

HELP! I HAVE A QUESTION! WHO DO I CONTACT :

Josh Steinberg -[masked] - [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a black SideStreet NYC tee shirt & holding an orange binder with SideStreet Tours logo
results.name: Walk New Amsterdam to the South Street Seaport

results.description:
I'd like to invite you to the #BromptonNYC event of the year... A silly celebration of Bromptons, Bratwurst, and Beers at one of Queens' coolest restaurants Max Bratwurst Und Bier. Renny - the owner of Max's - is a good friend of ours and is hooking us up with a private party room, a German Polka band, and - wait for it - a MAGICIAN! Come on. When's the last time you saw a live magician? I haven't in years...


Here's the kicker: like all proper Brompton themed event's the puns extend beyond the title. We've worked with the Bratmasters at Max's to concoct our own very special "Bromptwurst" just for your enjoyment!

Vegetarians and non-beer drinkers are loved and welcomed too! While these are not exactly Max's focus there are a number of truly delicious vegetarian side dishes available and soft drinks.

Rumor (confirmed rumor) has it that there will be a few German Brompton riders flying in as well as members of @BromptonMAFIA! Don't you want to go now? ;)

Wait - there's a ride beforehand?


That is correct my friend. In the spirit of German Alpen mountain climbing we're going to tackle the 7 highest peaks from City Hall to Max Bratwurst: Brooklyn, Manhattan, Williamsburg, Pulaski, Queensboro, Randall's Pedestrian, and Tri-boro. All to the sound of polka. Yes. It's a fool's mission. But we're fools. Right?

Here's the route we'll take. About 20 miles in 3 hours. Should be do-able!

Down to the details...

• The Ride - When/Where: High noon at City Hall park on the Manhattan side of the Brooklyn Bridge.

• The Party - When/Where: 3:00pm at Max Bratwurst in Queens. 

• Party Basic Cost - $10 which gets you a Beer and Brat of your choice!

• What to Wear - Casual! Costumes/silly outfits allowed you ask... for sure!

• Is there a hashtag? #BromptonNYC and #Bromptoberfest @MaxBratwurst

This ride/party loosely and lovingly hosted and organized by Peter Yuskauskas, Newton Dixon, and Renny Dushku
results.name: Bromptoberfest 2015

UPDATE! Please RSVP ASAP since this is a reservation place.

The Martian got great reviews, stars Matt Damon, directed by Ridley Scott (Alien, Gladiator, etc.) Since every one wants to see it in 3D and we have that offer from Starpass to see it at regular price, our best choice is the 3:25pm show, (142 minutes long.)

I am making a reservation at Bonefish Grill in Secaucus, about 4 miles from the movie at 7:30

Bonefish Grill Menu and directions 

It would seem logical to go to Kerasotes Theater in Secaucus but a. They make you buy specific seats online b. It's always sold out and c. Difficult to park.

I hope to see you all!

Erica

2016 IMdb Best Picture Contenders

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up groups, the number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending. If you have any questions contact the event organizer Dave Cervini at [masked].

If you are a novice or love art, our Chelsea Art Gallery Tours are a fun and casual way to explore a great part of the city while socializing and making new friends and connections.

With over 300 art galleries in Chelsea, our Gallery Tour  Led by Rafael Risemberg with a Ph.D. in arts education  finds the most innovative art, and leads you on an insightful, entertaining and affordable journey through the contemporary art scene.  Rafael explains the art in ways that makes the experience meaningful to those who don’t know a lot about art as well as those who do.


Our tours take place RAIN or SHINE, as we’re indoors over 90% of the time. You will be amazed at how much you will learn and enjoy both the art and the people on the tour!

The group will meet at The Death Avenue Cafe (formerly Gastro Market) prior to the tour.  That is at[masked]th ave at 28th street.  Following the tour many from the group stay together for a drink or a bite to eat.

Pay $25 when you arrive (exact change helps)

DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of the people come to this event on their own to meet new people and check out some cool art.

What do I wear? Dress for the weather.  Be casual and comfortable.

What to expect: We are piggy backing on a larger tour that has about 50-70 people.  We will have 10-15 from our group.  The age range for our people is 20's -40's ( the larger group is 20's - 60's)

How long does it last? about 2 hours

How do I know who is leading the group?  We meet separate from the main tour at a local cafe.  Our tour host will have a sign at the bar and you will have a chance to have something to eat or drink before we start the tour.  If you are not hungry just socialize.  When we are finished we walk over together to join the main tour.
results.name: NY Social Groups Chelsea Art Gallery Tour: Novices Welcome! Socialize & Learn

venue.name: Meet at Death Avenue Cafe (formerly Gastro Market)

results.description:
We didn't get around to a summer pub crawl this year, so we're going to do the next best thing: a fall pub crawl in early October. And we'll do the crawl in one of New York's hippest neighborhoods, yet one still full of Irish pubs: the East Village.

We'll start things off on the edge of the neighborhood at Slainte, 304 Bowery. From there, it's we'll proceed up the Bowery to Swift's Hibernian Lounge. Then it's around 4th to 2nd Avenue and Dempsey's. These are two of the most popular Irish pubs in the entire city.


After Dempsey's, we'll follow 4th Street into Alphabet City to the Dorian Gray Tap & Grill. Then head up towards Tompkins Square Park and St. Mark's Place to one of New York's most authentic Irish pubs, St. Dymphna's.

We'll make a brief sojourn to 1st Avenue and The Grafton, then it's back to St. Mark's Place and Bull McCabe's. We'll finish the crawl back on 2nd Avenue at The Thirsty Scholar. If we head north from there, there are a few more pubs to hit if folks are up for it.

Either way it'll be a fun Saturday afternoon and evening at some of New York's coolest Irish pubs.


See you there!
results.name: Fall Pub Crawl in the East Village

group.name: The New York Irish Pub Challenge Meetup

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Hi all,

We had an amazing time last Saturday as Earth Drum Circle was invited to facilitate the one hour drum circle at NYC Pagan Pride 2015 on the main stage at Washington Square Park. For photos of this event go to: http://alturl.com/tcer8 Additionally, below there are URLs to audio tracks on YouTube and for download on DropBox.

The date of our next Earth Drum Circle in Central Park at Cherry Hill will be Saturday, October 10th. We look forward to seeing all that can make it for this circle! Please RSVP to this event invite so that we have a heads up of who will be attending. Any questions can be sent to us via E-mail at: [masked] 

Blaze On!, 

DRAGON 

P. S. If need to contact me the day of this event you can reach me on my Cell: (917) 597-5801. Also, If it is supposed to be raining the day of the Drum Circle no need to cancel, we can have it at Casa de Dragón. 

When: Saturday, October 10th at 4:00 p.m. (We head into the Park to the Drum Circle location at 4:30 sharp!) 

Where: West 72nd Street & Central Park West - We meet at the benches on NE Corner just inside the entrance to the Park (If you reach the "Imagine" plaque at Strawberry Fields you have gone too far!) Please download these satellite image maps our locations (The benches and Cherry Hill). Print and bring them with you in case!!! 
http://alturl.com/giq5r 

What to Bring: Yourself (feel free to bring friends along), your drum, and any other percussion or other instruments. A folding chair or ground covering and some sun block are also good to have on hand. Food and Drink for Potluck: Please try to bring some food and or drink to share as we are tying to make the Drum Circles more of a potluck to sustain our drumming energies. 

EARTH DRUM CIRCLE AT NYC PAGAN PRIDE 2015

results.description:
Hola amigas y amigos!

Join us for the movie Mad Love ("Juana la Loca")! It will be an  afternoon of fun, entertainment and mucho, mucho español.

Mad Love, Spain (2001) is the love story that transformed Juana, Queen of Spain, into Juana "The mad". This delightful movie tells the story of Juana, the daughter of Catholic kings Ferndinand of Aragon and Isabella of Castille and her marriage to the Archduke Felipe de Austria, known as 'El Hermoso' (The Handsome) and son of the emperor Maximiliano. It's a movie of passions, lies and jealousy with a backdrop of political infighting.

IN SPANISH, WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES - SUITABLE FOR ALL LEVELS

WHERE

At EASY ESPANOL, located on the 11th floor (address is at the top). Can't miss it.

SPACE IS LIMITED, PLEASE PAY IN ADVANCE TO SECURE (RESERVE) A SPOT

EVENT SCHEDULE

Saturday, October 10th, 2015

5:00 pm: Door opens, arrive in venue. Meet others and practice your Spanish!

5:30 pm: A brief intro to the movie

5:45 pm: Movie starts!

7.15 pm: Movie ends - Short discussion afterwards.

ABOUT THE FILM

In 1496, Juana de Castilla, daughter of the Catholic Kings, travels to Flandes to marry the Archduke Felipe de Austria, known as 'El Hermoso' (The Handsome) and son of the emperor Maximiliano. Though this marriage is initially politically motivated, it later grows full of passion and desire.

COST

Just $6 online or  $10 at event (if space is available)

SPACE IS LIMITED; PLEASE PAY ONLINE IN ADVANCE TO SECURE (RESERVE) A SPOT. RSVPs without payment DO NOT reserve seats.

Advance payment will guarantee (reserve) a spot. You can also pay cash $10 at event if space is available.

No PayPal? No credit card? No problem. Please read ---> HERE

Read about Payment Confirmations ---> HERE

IMPORTANT NOTES
1) CANCELLATIONS/Event changes: Read ---> HERE
2) Please turn off your cell phone/beeper when movie starts
3) NO NEED TO BRING A PRINTED COPY of your online payment - But it might help if you do. Anyone who paid online will be in a list at the door under his/her paypal accountholder name or the name on the credit card (whichever was used to pay)

Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave,

results.description:
"Lucid dreaming is a documented phenomenon; researchers continue to explore it as it shows some very significant brain patterns and biological happenings within the body. A fairly recent example is a study conducted in 2009 at the Neurological Laboratory in Frankfurt. Research shows how Lucid dreamers produce the fastest brainwave frequencies ever recorded, gamma brainwaves that operate at 40Hz +. This indicates that our brains are functioning at a more clear, coherent and  higher state of consciousness than it is when we are awake." Arjun Walia


Come join us to explore different techniques to awaken our consciousness in our dreams, as well as in our daily lives, to increase our brain's cognitive capacity, giving us the ability to become more self aware and "present" from moment to moment. 

The awakening of the consciousness in man grants him "A particular type of apprehension of internal knowledge." Samael Aun Weor

Topics of discussion:

- The Human Consciousness.

- Lucid dreams & The Astral world

- Mindfulness.

- Meditation practice.

"Man, know yourself, and you shall know the universe and its Gods." The oracle of Delphi.

****Doors open at 4:45 and close at 5:45 for the meditation****

results.description:
In celebration of Hispanic Heritage Month, the Afro Latin Jazz Alliance and the Harlem School of the Arts are inviting the community in Harlem and beyond to join us in this event that highlights the history and diversity of Harlem in a day of music, dance and art.

Designed for children and their families, jazz aficionados and community members, Pueblo Harlem celebrates Hispanic heritage and Harlem’s mix of cultures, with performances by the Afro Latin Jazz Alliance’s youth orchestra, the Fat Afro Latin Jazz Cats, the GRIOT Youth Ensemble, folkloric dance classes, food, and additional visual arts demonstrations and workshops.

Below is a video of the event in 2013:

https://youtu.be/0cgtTVUWZlI

Arturo O’Farrill and the Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra will be closing the event, featuring works from their 2014 album The Offense of the Drum,, joined by Puerto Rican poet and arranger Christopher “Chilo” in a celebration of the Puerto Rican diaspora.

Our Meetup

Although the event starts at 11am, our Meetup will meet inside Harlem School of the Arts (HSA) at 5pm to catch the closing session with Arturo O'Farrill and the Latin Jazz Orchestra. The event & meetup ends at 7pm. The exact location where we'll meetup inside HSA will be announced the day of the event (please check the comments/notifications section for the update).

As always, if you have any questions, comments, or further directions than what is listed below, feel free to call or text Daniel at 774.275.3646. Thanks!


Directions & Parking around Harlem School of the Arts (HSA)

Train: Take the B or C train to 135th Street station and walk up St. Nicholas Avenue to 141st street. You can also take the A, B, C or D trains to 145th Street station and walk down.

Bus: The #3 bus (going uptown or downtown) to 140th street and St. Nicholas Street.

Parking: There is a parking garage on St. Nicholas Avenue (just north of HSA) between 141st & 145th street. Street parking also should be available in the nearby side streets.

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Typically Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y  (Oct 10th Host: Yen)

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

"CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level 
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active 
2. Spend more time socializing 
3. Be productive at meaningful work 
4. Get better organized and plan things out 
5. Stop worrying 
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations 
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking 
8. Become present oriented 
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality 
10. Work on a healthy personality 
11. Be yourself 
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems 
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness 
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

results.description:
I thought it would be fun thing for the month of October to explore some of the darker arts and darker sides of various genres. So for the first one we will be exploring and drawing from the darker side of Science Fiction. From scary and dangerous alien creatures, experiments gone awry, invasions, to monstrous mechs, to even shady extraterrestrial characters, and anything encompassing the darker side of the Science Fiction genre.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings, ideas, and the theme as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! 

Also if you'd like to share anything such as art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Halloween Month! Theme: The Darkside Of Science Fiction
