Our next Saturday Night Dance Social will be held on Saturday, October 10th!

Event Details:

The evening will begin with a fun absolute beginner Introduction to Dancing Class from 7-7:30pm, new dancers will be taught the basic steps to some of the most popular dances!

We will have an open level dance workshop from 7:30-9pm. The workshop this month will be Salsa Rueda, which is a fun Cuban Salsa dance that includes fun moves, danced in a circle!

-No experience is needed, and no partner is necessary!-

-Come out and learn to dance in a fun and relaxed atmosphere!-

After the dance workshop, you will be treated to an array of delicious snacks to keep you energized as we dance the night away! There will also be refreshments, including complimentary wine, and soft drinks.

We will have general dancing, so that we can continue to practice our new moves and dance the night away! We will play a mix of Salsa, Bachata, Cha Cha and Merengue, as well as some Rumba, Hustle and Swing, along with any other music requests!

Please contact Tiffinay at[masked] or at [masked] to RSVP, and with any questions about this event.

Saturday, October 10th- 

6-7pm Samba Class with Tiffinay and Chris

7-7:30pm Absolute Beginners Introduction to Dance Class

7:30-9pm Special Salsa Rueda Workshop with Fernando Polanco 

9-12:30am Social dancing, refreshments and fun! 

NEW Discounted Admission!


$15, with RSVP, will include your fun dance workshop lessons, refreshments and a night out social dancing!

$20 at the door

You can RSVP for this event below or visit our web-site or Facebook page to RSVP today!

You can find more information about our classes and events by visiting our Web-site,  Spirare Dance Studio. You can also find us on Facebook,  Spirare Dance.

You can also check out the event page on Facebook, Ballroom in Bayside!
results.how_to_find_us: The studio is located at the end of 41st Ave, off of Bell Blvd, between Donovan's Tavern and the municipal parking lot. Take the LIRR to the Bayside Stop or the Q13 Bus to Bell Blvd/42nd Ave. If driving, there is metered-parking in the lot next door.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 42-55  SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

group.name: ...And That's Why You're Single Speed Dating Parties

results.description:
Network of Indian Professionals NA 

                                        Casino Night 

                                                  &

                                    Sunday Night Gala

Click Here to Buy Tickets to the Events 

NetIP North America’s annual conference hosts hundreds of South Asian professionals from different parts of the United States, who excel in every aspect of western society, from business to politics to the arts to build relationships, explore new ideas, and move beyond traditional boundaries. 

This year the conference is being held in New York City, and there would be bunch of events happening over the course of two days, but two the main attractions for the weekend are going to be the Casino Night on Oct 10th and the Sunday Night Gala on Oct 11th.

Click Here to Buy Tickets to the Events 

Join the Network of Indian Professionals on Sunday evening, October 11, 2015, as we celebrate "International Day of the Girl" and support the Girl Rising India Global Fund at the Annual NetIP Conference Gala. 

This inspirational evening will include:  

Emcee Nina Davuluri 
Performance by Mystic India 
Performance by Hari Kondabolu 
Keynote Speech by Preet Bharara 
NetIP Founder Dr. Satish Chandra 
Silent Auction / Raffle 
Dinner

Click Here to Buy Tickets to the Events 

“Begin Again”signifies that NO challenge is too big to overcome and that “You are only as strong as your next move”. Our speakers will aspire the professionals: Build themselves Professionally, Encourage political involvement, Give back to the community. Invest in the future generations, all while networking with the best of the best professionals from across the nation. 

 Join us for thought provoking conversations, sharing of innovative experiences and ideas, and walk away with a fresh approach to life.

Click Here to Buy Tickets to the Events

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
**Meetup-platsen är bestämd. Om du inte fått någon e-post från mig med platsdetaljer, vänligen hör av dig genom att klicka på det lilla kuvertet till vänster.**

Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska, norska eller danska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är inte prata engelska från[masked] pm)


Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.

At our meetups, conversation is mainly in the Scandinavian language of your choice, and therefore attendance is limited to those who can, at a minimum, hold down a simple conversation in Swedish, Danish or Norwegian. If you have any questions about what this means, please contact us.

Please RSVP respectfully. We are a real group of friends and our etiquette reflects that. If you realize you can't make it, that's fine, just update your RSVP.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Join Us for Guided Meditation and Discussion with Bhante Saddhasara!

results.description:
Join multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll through Astoria ending at Astoria Flea and Food Night Market. Every 6 to 10 minutes (depending on the size of the group) I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken with until everyone has spoken with everyone. Check out the photos from one of our previous Astoria walks. It was a great turnout and we had an awesome time! 

Afterwards, we'll check out Astoria Flea and Food at Kaufman Studios. Click this link to see more info on Astoria Flea and Food Night Market. 

We'll meet at 6:30 PM in front of the McDonald's which is located at at the last stop of the N/Q line in Astoria. When you get out, look for the McDonald's and those gorgeous people standing there will be us.  

The walk will start at EXACTLY 7 PM. If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be easy-going. The total distance is a little over 1.5 miles. It shouldn't take more than 45 minutes from start to finish. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of McDonald's at the last stop of the N/Q line (Ditmars Blvd) and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, if you do not like approaching a massive group of strangers, you can CALL the organizer at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
Join multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll through Astoria ending at Astoria Flea and Food Night Market. Every 6 to 10 minutes (depending on the size of the group) I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken with until everyone has spoken with everyone. Check out the photos from one of our previous Astoria walks. It was a great turnout and we had an awesome time! 

Afterwards, we'll check out Astoria Flea and Food at Kaufman Studios. Click this link to see more info on Astoria Flea and Food Night Market. 

We'll meet at 6:30 PM in front of the McDonald's which is located at at the last stop of the N/Q line in Astoria. When you get out, look for the McDonald's and those gorgeous people standing there will be us.  

The walk will start at EXACTLY 7 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be easy-going. The total distance is a little over 1.5 miles. It shouldn't take more than 45 minutes from start to finish. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of McDonald's at the last stop of the N/Q line (Ditmars Blvd) and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, if you do not like approaching a massive group of strangers, you can CALL the organizer at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-experience-after-hours-tour-morbid-anatomy-museum-tickets-18810052373

Join New York Adventure Club on the evening of October 10 for an after-hours tour of the Morbid Anatomy Museum in Gowanus, Brooklyn. 


Our guided tour will include objects from the private (and morbid) cabinets of an eccentric Victorian taxidermist, the 18th century Prime Minister of Denmark and Ryan Cohn of TV's Oddities. Pieces from the collection include a two-headed kitten, a scrap-book filled with human hair, and spirit photos. 


Also, the tour will cover Opus Hypnagogia: Sacred Spaces of the Visionary and Vernacular, an exhibition by Stephen Romano in recognition of the museum’s first year anniversary. The exhibition examines the place the visionary occupies as the “HYPNAGOGIA”, defined as the experience of the transitional state from wakefulness to sleep: the hypnagogic state of consciousness, when mental phenomena such as lucid dreaming, hallucinations, and sleep paralysis occur. 

Click here to see pictures from our last visit to the Morbid Anatomy Museum! 

After the tour we will be visiting a local eatery for food and drinks!
results.name: NY Adventure Club Experience: After-Hours Tour @ Morbid Anatomy Museum

results.description:
Hey peeps who's up for a backyard fire pit party?

My good friend Michelle has been wanting me to have one for a long time now so I decided it was time! Since she has her kids (age 11 and 8) this weekend we are going to make it a kid friendly event so feel free to bring your kids too if you want, if they get bored we can always put a Netflix movie on for them in the house.

So the plan is to show up at my house anytime after 7pm (please do not come early) Bring either a snack or beverage to share. (hard alcohol is not permitted at my home) I will supply the paper goods. Please post what you are bringing to avoid duplication. I also need wood for the fire pit. You can get it at lowes/home depot, many grocery stores, stands along side the road etc. Also bring a chair to sit on and if its chilly dress warm.

Also please check in the day of for a weather update, rain will cancel this event.

Look forward to seeing YOU around the fire!    Love, Cassie

*if you can not come no need to post why we understand and will catch you another time*

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk SEX is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.


Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska and Cynthia Kagoshima

Saturday Oct 10th,[masked]:00~9:00 PM

150 West 28th Street Ste 1803New York, NY 10001

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-18716768358

Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.
results.name: Take A Risk: SEX! with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

results.description:
www.LastRitesGallery.TV

www.LastRitesGallery.Tumblr.com


www.LastRitesGallery.com


LAST RITES GALLERY is pleased to present it's eighth annual The 13th Hour group exhibition, celebrating the spirit of the Halloween Season. In its annual exhibit, Last Rites sets out to present a broad-spectrum representation of Dark Surrealism. Held days just before Halloween, the show is the gallery's largest group exhibition, and features renowned artists from around the globe- working in an array of mediums including painting, drawing and sculpture. From gothic elegance to finely crafted grotesquery, the beauty within the darkness is embraced and brought into the spotlight.


Last Rites Gallery is pleased to present The 13th Hour, a group exhibition conceived by Paul Booth to celebrate the dual nature of humanity and invite the viewers to take part in one of the most engaging and comprehensive art-related experiences of the year. In its annual exhibit, Last Rites Gallery sets out to display a broad-spectrum representation of Contemporary Surrealism focused on the human form and condition.

This year’s The 13th Hour exhibition will revolve around the exploration of innovative mediums and materials through a dynamic interpretation of the artists’ unique individual thought and vision. From intricate renderings to simple transfigurations of the peculiar and the unknown, the artists are going to utilize art as a way of holding up a mirror to the self and turn their perceptions into finely crafted depictions of their own fears and nightmares suspended between dream-like landscapes and reality.

The 13th Hour will feature over thirty local and international artists including Logan J. Aguilar, William Basso, Rick Beaupre, Mikael Bourgoin, Jana Brike, Matt Dangler, Fabio D’Aroma, Yoko D’Holbachie, Sergio Garcia, Jason Goldberg, Fred Harper, David Hochbaum, Henrik Aa. Uldalen, Nom Kinnear King, Hope Kroll, Eric Lacombe, Todd Lim, Eli Livingston, Chris Mars, Brian Mashburn, Menton3, Yomico Moreno, CT Nelson, Chris Peters, Kevin W. Peterson, Shane Pierce, David Richardson, Matthew Ryan Sharp, Kaspian Shore, A.W. Sommers, David Stoupakis, Trent Taft, Johnson Tsang, Nicomi Nix Turner, Daniel Williams, Jasmine Worth. Together these artists are going to show the “beauty within the darkness” that is inherent to the puzzling and yet undeniably intriguing mechanism of the human mind.

LAST RITES GALLERY


Established in 2008, Last Rites has become a premiere gallery for the Dark Art movement and a haven for artists who prefer to explore the ominous, uncomfortable, and eccentric in their work. Striving to showcase some of the most thought-provoking art in contemporary surrealism, Last Rites creates an atmosphere where the artist can harness limitless expression and the observer can reflect inward, inspired to understand that which resides in us all.


https://youtu.be/A9SSmVFrsPA


https://youtu.be/mR-8-vM-QCo
results.name: THE 13th HOUR - opening reception for the new exhibit at Paul Booth's Last Rites

results.description:
Let's go see The Martian at the Alamo DraftHouse on Saturday Oct 10th - for the 7:15 pm showing. This film has been getting great buzz and i want to see it -- and thought others might want to also. We'll go to Alamo so we can have dinner and drinks while we watch the movie, too! 

If you're not into seeing the Martian there are other films around the same time as well -- check on their website to learn more -- https://drafthouse.com/nyc-area/theater/yonkers

Get ready to be blown away. THE MARTIAN starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Kristen Wiig with a special screening of the upcoming film directed by Ridley Scott. THE MARTIAN is the story of what happens during a manned mission to Mars, when Astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead after a fierce storm and left behind by his crew. But Watney has survived and finds himself stranded and alone on the hostile planet. With only meager supplies, he must draw upon his ingenuity, wit and spirit to subsist and find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive. Millions of miles away, NASA and a team of international scientists work tirelessly to bring “the Martian” home, while his crewmates concurrently plot a daring, if not impossible rescue mission.


Please buy your tickets in advance, so we can all sit together.. and arrive by 6:45 so we can order dinner and drinks..  I bought ROW 3 Seat 13 for the 7:15 show.. 

Hope to see  you there!

results.description:
A special public lecture and stargazing event at William Paterson University

</a>Saturday, October 10, 7:30 PM - 11:30 PM.
Science Hall East, Room 2064, WPU 
Free and open to the general public 
Stargazing hotline: [masked]

<a href="http://www.wpunj.edu/cosh/departments/physics/news-and-events.dot">http://www.wpunj.edu/cosh/departments/physics/news-and-events.dot

Details:

Come out for a great evening of stargazing fun with William Paterson University. Then, we'll have a public lecture on the search for life in the universe. Prof. Jason Kendall of WPU's Physics Department will talk about astronomers' search for life on other planets, including Mars, Titan, Enceladus and beyond! Following the talk, we'll take a walk out to the Wightman Football Field to go stargazing. You'll be able to see stars and nebulae through a telescope! If it's clear, it'll be third-quarter Moon, giving us a wonderful view of the wonders of the sky. The telescopes will be operated by Prof. Kendall's Introduction to Astronomy class. They've been working hard all semester learning the skies and and are ready to be your Star Ambassadors. In the event of a cloudy or rainy night, we'll follow the lecture with a 45-minute movie. Please also make sure to call the hotline, because the stargazing event will be changed to a movie in the event of clouds or rain. Local area amateur astronomers are invited to bring their telescopes. Kids and families are welcome. This event is hosted by the faculty of the Physics Department of William Paterson University. 

“Searching for Life Out There in the Universe”

Throughout time, mankind has looked into the heavens and wondered if we were alone in the universe. Now, we are starting to take the first steps to understanding whether or not our wildest dreams are true. Whether it's flowing water on Mars, or salty jets on Enceladus, or even potential methane-based life on cold Titan, evidence is just now beginning to come in. The SETI team continually searches for signals from space, and the Kepler Space Telescope has found evidence for thousands of Earth-sized worlds, with the first potential Earth-2.0 found this year. It's an exciting time to search for E.T.!

About Jason Kendall:

Jason Kendall teaches Astronomy at William Paterson University. He's been seen on The Weather Channel's “Wake Up With Al” for a monthly segment on astronomy and stargazing. He's also been seen on CBS NY, FOX5 NY, and on WNYC radio. He's given public lectures and events all over NJ, NY, PA, CT, with featured speaking engagements at the Hayden Planetarium, Columbia University, The Cherry Springs Star Party, The Explorers Club, the Wayne YMCA, the United Astronomy Clubs of New Jersey and numerous other venues. He leads the metro area as a public speaker on astronomy engaging both the young and the experienced on all areas from black holes to the Big Bang. More information and booking at www.jasonkendall.com

Parking:

Please use Lot #2, which is right next to the Wightman Football Field. There will be signs from Pompton Road, to turn north onto Mills Drive. Park in Lot #2 and walk up to the football field. The stargazing event will be on the track in front of the home seats. The public lecture is in Science Hall East.

Hotline:

Since stargazing depends upon clear nights, if it cloudy or rainy, we'll cancel the outdoor program. Please call the event hotline above for updates about whether or not we'll be stargazing.
​
results.how_to_find_us: It's a small place, look for the guy with the bow tie.
results.name: A Public Lecture by Jason Kendall: "Searching for Life Out in the Universe"

It's time to learn Michael Jackson's legendary "Thriller" dance for THRILL DAY. Zombies from the Tri-state area will be joining us on Saturday, October 24th from 2pm-6pm with the main THRILLER dance to be held world-wide at 5pm.

This class is for all those participants who already Pre-registered for THRILL DAY. You must be registered for the event to join this class. To do so visit https://www.eventbrite.com/e/thrill-the-world-nyc-zombie-masquerade-ball-tickets-16927870717

YouTube videos to learn the dance are located on our website: http://thrilltheworldnyc.com/ttw-thriller-dance

Please don't forget that we will be holding a www.pajamaprogram.com drive on Saturday, October 24th where you can bring a pair of pajamas or new children's book.

Amada aka Mama Zombie and the TTWNYC Staff

results.description:
A special public lecture and stargazing event at William Paterson University


Saturday, October 10, 7:30 PM - 11:30 PM.
Science Hall East, Room 2064, WPU
Free and open to the general public
Stargazing hotline: [masked]

http://www.wpunj.edu/cosh/departments/physics/news-and-events.dot

Details:


Come out for a great evening of stargazing fun with William Paterson University. Then, we'll have a public lecture on the search for life in the universe. Prof. Jason Kendall of WPU's Physics Department will talk about astronomers' search for life on other planets, including Mars, Titan, Enceladus and beyond! Following the talk, we'll take a walk out to the Wightman Football Field to go stargazing. You'll be able to see stars and nebulae through a telescope! If it's clear, it'll be third-quarter Moon, giving us a wonderful view of the wonders of the sky. The telescopes will be operated by Prof. Kendall's Introduction to Astronomy class. They've been working hard all semester learning the skies and and are ready to be your Star Ambassadors. In the event of a cloudy or rainy night, we'll follow the lecture with a 45-minute movie. Please also make sure to call the hotline, because the stargazing event will be changed to a movie in the event of clouds or rain. Local area amateur astronomers are invited to bring their telescopes. Kids and families are welcome. This event is hosted by the faculty of the Physics Department of William Paterson University. 

“Searching for Life Out There in the Universe”

Throughout time, mankind has looked into the heavens and wondered if we were alone in the universe. Now, we are starting to take the first steps to understanding whether or not our wildest dreams are true. Whether it's flowing water on Mars, or salty jets on Enceladus, or even potential methane-based life on cold Titan, evidence is just now beginning to come in. The SETI team continually searches for signals from space, and the Kepler Space Telescope has found evidence for thousands of Earth-sized worlds, with the first potential Earth-2.0 found this year. It's an exciting time to search for E.T.!

About Jason Kendall

Jason Kendall teaches Astronomy at William Paterson University. He's been seen on The Weather Channel's “Wake Up With Al” for a monthly segment on astronomy and stargazing. He's also been seen on CBS NY, FOX5 NY, and on WNYC radio. He's given public lectures and events all over NJ, NY, PA, CT, with featured speaking engagements at the Hayden Planetarium, Columbia University, The Cherry Springs Star Party, The Explorers Club, the Wayne YMCA, the United Astronomy Clubs of New Jersey and numerous other venues. He leads the metro area as a public speaker on astronomy engaging both the young and the experienced on all areas from black holes to the Big Bang. More information and booking at www.jasonkendall.com

Parking:

Please use Lot #2, which is right next to the Wightman Football Field. There will be signs from Pompton Road, to turn north onto Mills Drive. Park in Lot #2 and walk up to the football field. The stargazing event will be on the track in front of the home seats. The public lecture is in Science Hall East.

Hotline:

Since stargazing depends upon clear nights, if it cloudy or rainy, we'll cancel the outdoor program. Please call the event hotline above for updates about whether or not we'll be stargazing.
​
results.how_to_find_us: It's a small place, look for the guy with the bow tie.
results.name: A Public Lecture by Jason Kendall: "Searching for Life Out in the Universe"

results.description:
Internationally recognized as among the great exponents of Hindustani classical music, Pandit Ramesh Misra (sarangi) and Pandit Samar Saha (tabla) have been close collaborators for decades, developing a musical rapport of intuition and subtle communication. While possessing deep technical mastery, the maestros opt for beauty over virtuosity, tailoring their melodic and rhythmic creations to the present moment and unfolding a unique musical presentation in each performance.

News flash! Buy your tickets now for the upcoming concert with Samar Saha and Ramesh Misra and you can get a $5 discount. Here's the discount code and instructions on how to use it:

The $5 off code is now active: 5offSaha

This can be used online, at the front desk, or by calling/emailing the box office [masked] x344/ [masked])

http://rubinmuseum.org/events/event/samar-saha-ramesh-misra-10-10-2015

Presented with Harrice Miller Entertainment and community partner Sunny Thakkar.

Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at The Wheeltapper Pub.

At present we need both men and women aged 29 to 39 although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.

Grab friends and come along to The Wheeltapper Pub to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance.  As of 2:00 PM, we still have spots open for $20.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me


(i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>). If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

regards, Daniel

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 30-42 - 2M/2F SPOTS LEFT

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Okay, we all know a lot of exceptional people. Some of them happen to be single. And a lot of us are always complaining about how we never meet anyone decent to date. Let's get together and do what works when it comes to dating -- meeting people through friends and seeing immediately if there's chemistry.

Our fantastic EWNYC members will review all the great single friends we know and invite a few of them to join us for an evening of fun. Doesn't matter who they are, there is only one criteria that they need and that's to be completely single. The great thing is that these are people whose 100% awesomeness can be vouched for -- none of us are friends with serial killers, right? It's not mandatory but you should probably be single also, you might make a connection here of your own.

The Rules ...

In order to keep the ratio of the sexes somewhat even, we do not want to discourage members from attending if they do not have a friend to come with. For example, if your friends, coworker, gym buddy and lunch mate is busy simply come. Will be your single friend

There are no age restrictions regarding the friends you can bring. EWNYC has members of all ages and who are we to stand in the way of the blossoming of a May-December romance.

If you would like to attend you cannot bring a friend you must come alone. Please contact the organizer. We are a friendly group and enjoy the time in this intimate setting. The organizer needs a single friend (contact her she is on the rsvp list)

A list will be created of all attendees so when RSVP'ing. If you are not able to attend, change your rsvp and do not keep others from attending

Spread The Word ...

I emailed the idea for this event to a few select friends and you would be amazed at how many liked the idea and would like to attend. Start talking to the single people you know and I'm sure you'll get a bunch of enthusiastic responses.

 

Best Regards

EWNYC

results.description:
3 Bruce Campbells, 3 dance operas, 3 times the fun!
  Put your sawed-off severed hands together! Following the success of their rock opera ballet “SEVERED: The Tragic Loves of Frankenstein’s Monster”, The Love Show and .357 LOVER reunite to bring you an evening of mayhem, beauty and slapstick through dance and original live music, based on films starring the Cary Grant of cult classic horror flicks, BRUCE CAMPBELL!

Presented by The Love Show & .357 Lover

https://youtu.be/uItv9C3q0dk

 
Act I: Evil Dead 2
Act II: Bubba Ho-Tep
Act III: Army of Darkness
  Featuring:

Choreographed and directed by Angela Harriell, performed by The Love Show Dancers

Music & Lyrics by Corn Mo, performed by .357 Lover

with Special Surprise Guests!!
 


ONE NIGHT ONLY!
  Tickets:

VIP seats (front row): $30 advance, $35 day of show
Seated: $20 advance, $25 day of show
Standing: $10 advance, $15 day of show

TABLE SEATING POLICY

Table seating for all seated shows is reserved exclusively for ticket holders who purchase “Table Seating” tickets. By purchasing a “Table Seating” ticket you agree to also purchase a minimum of two food and/or beverage items per person. Table seating is first come, first seated. Please arrive early for the best choice of available seats. Seating begins when doors open. Tables are communal so you may be seated with other patrons. We do not take table reservations.
  A standing room area is available by the bar for all guests who purchase "Standing Room" tickets. Food and beverage can be purchased at the bar but there is no minimum purchase required in this area.
  All tickets sales are final. No refund or credits.

THE LOVE SHOW is a theatrical dance company based in Brooklyn that combines cabaret, ballet, rock, comedy and theater into creative performances all over the US and beyond. The Love Show has entertained all audiences, from glitzy nightclub fashionistas to gritty downtown theatergoers and has rocked stages performing from Lebowskifest to The BBC gala. The Love Show was commissioned to perform original choreography for the New York screening of The Antics Roadshow, a new film by Banksy, and has also created original work for Veuve Cliquoit, Dom Perignon, and Vouge Magazine. An active presence on the New York art scene, The Love Show was also awarded a week long residency with Chashama, and recently closed the seventh season of their very popular holiday show, Nutcracker: Rated R, which they also performed in Tokyo. The Love Show also has two other full length productions, Dance Mayhem: A Grindhouse Ballet, (set to re-open in November at Theater for the New City), and SEVERED: The Tragic Loves of Frankenstein’s Monster (premiered to a sold-out house at Highline Ballroom). The New York Post and many other publications have praised The Love Show, and The New York Times sent a reporter to exclusively follow the troupe’s exploits on Bastille Day.
  .357 LOVER is an arena rock band originally from Denton, TX. Moving to NYC, they became a backing band for both John Cameron Mitchell of Hedwig and Andrew WK, respectively. In addition to supporting Andrew WK, they’ve supported They Might Be Giants and Ben Folds. At the Ars Nova Theater, they staged the rock opera Alice Wakeman and are planning to do it again. They also collaborated with Circus Una in the production of the rock musical Circus By the Sea. In 2014, they collaborated with The Love Show and created Severed: The Tragic Loves of Frankenstein’s Monster.
  .357 Lover consists of Ron Salvo (drums), Avi Fox-Rosen (guitar), Steve Dawson (guitar) Dave Wallin (bass), and Corn Mo (piano and vocals). .357 Lover’s dynamics include power-chord riffs and densely-packed, narrative structures, a homunculus of Queen and Tiny Tim. The first EP Your Favorite Hamburger is Cheeseburger was released in 2007. The long-playing sophomore effort Diorama of the Golden Lion was released in 2009. In 2014, they released a vinyl record/board game called The Purchase of the North Pole. They are working on the next one.

results.description:
NOTE: This Meet Up is being hosted by several different groups.  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
We have had some local players tell us the field is usually empty these nights. The parks dept refuses to give us a permit for the time. I am willing to try and see if we can get the games in on the off weeks until the Winter Season starts on 12/5, when we have the permit for every Saturday.

Please remember we have no permit. I will hold the game and hope for the best. Their will be no payment for this game.

Same Rules Apply

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) Keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot. No-Shows will be banned from the group.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

results.description:
<<--Please note RUSSIAN GP race Starts at 7:00 AM EDT-->>

Hello F1 Fans,

Round 15 of the 2015 Formula One season heads to the Sochi Autodrom near the Black Sea for the second annual Russian Grand Prix. The 5.848 km track is the third-longest of the year, behind Spa and Silverstone. Sochi is a medium-speed circuit with a variety of different corners, including a left-hander inspired by the famous long triple apex Turn 8 at Istanbul Park. The track features 12 right and six left-hand corners, with a 650-meter straight between the first and second turns, on which the cars reach a top speed of around 200 mph.

STANDINGS - After a dominant win at Suzuka, Lewis Hamilton now leads in the Drivers' Championship by 48 points. The standings are: Hamilton on top with 277 points, Nico Rosberg in second with 229 points and Sebastian Vettel in third with 218 points. In the Constructors' Championship, Mercedes leads with 506 points, Ferrari holds second with 337 points, and Williams is in third with 208 points.


TIRE ALLOCATION - Pirelli has altered the tire allocation (from last year) to its two softest compounds: Yellow soft (prime) and Red supersoft (option).


So can Lewis Hamilton win again in Sochi? Or can Nico Rosberg finally break through with a much needed win? Or can Sebastian Vettel close the gap with a win?

If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Russian Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 7:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 6:30AM EDT. It's going to be another fantastic race.


We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2015 Russian Grand Prix

results.description:
SKYRIDER ZIPLINE TOUR

We are coming back to New York Zipline Adventure Tours for another Skyrider Ziplining. The longest, fastest and highest Zipline Tour in North America and the 2nd largest in the world! Check out the pictures from previous event.


After trying Zipline & Rope Courses (pictures), and Canopy Tours (pictures), we are you ready for the fastest, longest, and highest Zipline Canopy Tour in North America? We will also enjoy the foliage view along the way or optionally have a foliage hike after the event.

Experience the longest, fastest and highest Zipline Tour in North America and the 2nd largest in the world! This is an Extreme Activity and it is not for everyone. With over 4.6 miles of ziplines, the SkyRider Tour begins with a scenic chair lift ride or an exciting off-road adventure to the Hunter Mountain Summit Lodge. Attend Zipline Pilot Training School where you will be educated on pertinent flight and safety information that will fully maximize your zipping experience. The tour includes five unique side by side racing ziplines. The first of which sets you soaring instantly on a 3,200 foot cable 600 feet above the valley, reaching speeds of up to 50 mph! This tour also features a special 500' self powered zap-line or a burma bridge option. Allow approximately 3 hours to complete your tour.

OKTOBERFEST

Our Oktoberfest, now 4 weekends long, features authentic German and German-American entertainment in the beauty of the northern Catskills in autumn. Experience live entertainment and great food surrounded by lush fall foliage.  Our modern celebration of the harvest features numerous vendors, free crafts for the kids, and much more. Free Admission makes it an affordable, fun time for all ages. Hours: 11am to 6:15pm, rain or shine.

Oct. 10-11: Das Laufwerk Eurocar Rally - The perfect event for VW enthusiasts! Click here for more info.

Depart Date: October 11th Sunday (Event: 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM). Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 7:00 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) 

Depart 7:30 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 9th Ave & West 43rd St., New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart from Hunter at 3 PM & expect to be back NYC around 5:30 PM  & Flushing at 6:00 PM

Cost: Early birds $149 for first 6 spots or 14 days in advance (Retail value: 129 + $40 Transport = $169); Afterward Regular $159. Last date to book the ticket is 10/3 Saturday; afterward event will be closed for booking.

Trip includes: Round trip Benz Sprinter van transportation from NYC, 3 hours Skyrider Tour & admission to Okctoberfest at Hunter Mountain

Buy Ticket Here: http://oct2015skyriderzipline.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location: Flushing or Manhattan. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Maximum: 12

Videos

NY Zipline Adventures - Longest & Highest - at Hunter Mountain!!


http://youtu.be/KMSYCVBi2Fc


http://youtu.be/KMSYCVBi2Fc

New York Zipline Adventure Tours, Skyrider Tour, Hunter Mountain, 2011

http://youtu.be/BM32xvx3gZE

http://youtu.be/BM32xvx3gZE

Pictures from Previous Skyrider Tour Trip

2012: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAAA/photos/10978412/163956392/

Refund Policy:

* $15 processing fee if cancelled 10 days in advance; 
* 50% refund if cancelled 5 days in advance; 
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 5 days.

By RSVPing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
This route gets its name because the last time I rode it we ran into 2 huge rattlesnakes dead center of the trail! The ride will focus on dirt roads and trails starting just north of Candlewood Lake and traveling through Kent up to Housatonic State forest. Once in CT the trip is predominantly on dirt roads with a number of trails that we can explore along the way. The ride can be as challenging or low key as we would like.

For those of you in lower Westchester, we will be meeting in the Burger King parking lot on Central avenue in Yonkers. There are a number of gas stations right near by. For those of you in upper Westchester & CT, we can plan on meeting at MAX BMW on Federal Road in Brookfield CT at around 8:00.

The entire trip from lower Westchester will total about 250 miles.
results.how_to_find_us: Brian and I will be on KLR650s in the parking lot.
results.name: Rattlesnake Run

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

venue.name: Central Park Boat House

results.description:
NEW YORK CITY DUATHLON

Central Park Boathouse - Sunday, October 11, 2015

Start - 7:30 am

COMPETITOR INFORMATION

ABSOLUTELY NO PARTS OF ENTRY FEES CAN BE REFUNDED, TRANSFERRED OR CREDITED.

ENTRY FEE:
$60 - before July 11
$70 - July 12 - September 11
$80 - September 12 - October 10
$85 - race day* No T-shirts to race day entries!

Online entry ends on Thursday, October 8 at 5:00 p.m.!

- $5 discount to NYTRI members
- In person new entries accepted Saturday or Sunday.
- No personal checks or credit cards accepted on weekend of race.

NEW YORK TRIATHLON - NYTRI has been a leader in organization of multi-sport events since 1984 and is proud to claim the best safety record in the country. The following rules and regulations have been designed for your personal safety and enjoyment. Failure to comply with these rules will result in penalties and/or disqualification. Instructions at the pre-race briefing supersede any or all of the following rules.

· Race management has authority to change race course and format, check-in and start times.
· No entrants under 18 years of age.
· It is the contestant's responsibility to be familiar with and follow the race course and be knowledgable of the race rules and regulations as outlined below..
· It is prohibited to sell your race number or for someone to compete in your place.
- Please read the complete list of penalties and disqualifications that is included herein. IMPORTANT:
Race packets will not be issued without your knowing your race bib number and presenting photo ID!
You will receive an email with you race bib number approximately 3-4 days before the event. At check-in you must know your bib number before getting in to the line that corresponds to your bib number.
If you do not receive your email and do not know your bib number, you may look it up on an alphabetical entrants list posted near the registration tables before getting in line for packet pick up.
There will be a label attached to your bib number that has all your personal and race information. Please check it for accuracy and notify registration officials immediately if you find discrepancies.

Saturday: Pre-Race Day
4:30 - 6:00 p.m. - Packet pick up (optional) for pre-registered competitors and new entries accepted at the parking lot of the Boathouse in Central Park.
You may not pick up a number for anyone except yourself!

Sunday: Race Day
6:00 - 7:15 am. - Central Park Boathouse parking lot - Packet pick up for registered competitors. New entries accecpted. Pick up computer timing chip.
7:15 am. - Pre-race announcements.No race packets saved after 7:15 am!
7:30 am. - Race Start (rain, snow or shine)
9:45 am. - Awards ceremony, refreshments

FIELD: Limited to 600 competitors.

DIVISIONS:
Narrow Tire (racing, road bikes)
Fat Tire (mountain, street, all-terrain bikes - tires greater than 1.25" or 30 mm).
Bikes that have tires narrower than 1.25 inch (30 mm) will be in the "Narrow tire division. All other bikes will be in the Fat tire division (including slicks).

Note: Changing between divisions is allowed only if a request is received by email at least 6 days before the event. After this time no switches between divisions will be allowed! Competitors who compete in the wrong division will be disqualified

AWARDS: 1st, 2nd, 3rd overall and in 5-year groups; 18-70+ (men), 18-60+ (women) in Narrow tire division and 10-year age groups in Fat tire division.

*** To receive an award you must be present at the awards ceremony RUN : The 2 mile run starts on East Drive at 74th Street, goes north to a turn around point at 96th Street (on East Drive) and back along the same route to the transition area. The turn point is indicated by a "U-Turn" sign affixed to the top of a green cone. Runners must stay to the left side of the runner's lane (both out and back), as indicated by the "Runners Stay Left" signs affixed to large green cones along the run course. The second run is identical to the first.
You must wear the run number on your front, and be clearly visible to race officials at ALL times. Folding of race numbers is prohibited.

BIKE : The bike course (12 mi.) consists of two (6 mile) loops of Central Park in a counter-clockwise direction. Bikers must stay in the middle and right lanes at ALL times and may not enter the runners (left) lane under ANY circumstances!

CENTRAL PARK ALERT! The course is closed to cars (except for official vehicles) but not to pedestrians, joggers, cyclists, skaters, etc. While biking, competitors must be aware and considerate of non-competitors who will also be sharing the Park roads with competitors. You do not have right of way or priority over other users of Central Park because you are competing in this event.
- Each contestant is individually responsible for repair and maintenance of their bike.
- Bikes are not allowed inside the Boathouse and must be left in the transition area.

TRANSITION AREA: In order to protect your bike and equipment, please make sure that only competitors are in the transition area. No friends and/or family should accompany competitors inside the barriers. Bicycles must be properly placed on assigned racks corresponding to race number. NO riding in the transition area or past the "DISMOUNT" signs.

NOTE: Bikes may be removed by competitors ONLY upon showing BOTH the run number and bike number to security personnel.

HELMETS: Penalties will be assessed if cycling helmets are not positively secured with chin strap BEFORE leaving the transition area. Riding without a hard-shell helmet will result in immediate disqualification! DRAFTING: You must maintain a distance of THREE bike lengths from the bike in front of you! You may not be closer than this distance for any period exceeding 15 seconds. If you are, you will be assessed a two minute penalty for each infraction.

DRAFTING (riding in a pack) is a Serious Violation of the Rules of this Event!
If another competitor is drafting you, yell to him to STOP DRAFTING! If you wish to file an official complaint regarding drafters, you must record their race number. A competitor who has three drafting reports filed by other competitors will automatically receive a two minute penalty.

===========================================================
RACE NUMBERS/ELECTRONIC TIMING:
On the morning of the race you will pick up an electronic timing chip that corresponds to your assigned bib number. This chip must be attached with a velcro strap to your ankle.and must remain attached throughout the entire event.
After you finish the event, you must remove the chip and drop it in the collection bin at the end of the finish line chute.
If you lose your chip during the race or fail to turn it in after you cross the finish line, you will be charged $100 for the lost chip.
Your bib number must be attached to the FRONT of your shirt (or race belt) during the entire race. You will not be allowed entry in to the transition area if your bib number is not clearly visible
If you enter the transition area or cross the finish line and your number is not clearly visible on your FRONT, you will be receive a 2 minute penalty.
The 2-sided vinyl (adhesive-backed) bike frame number must be attached to the front of the top tube of your bicycle and for security reasons may not be removed until you leave the leave the transition area.
Check the label affixed to your bib number for correct information regarding your name, age, sex and tire division (N-narrow tire, F-fat tire).
Notify officials prior to the race of any mistakes!

FINISH LINE: Stay in finishing order in the chute, come to a stop at the "Stop"sign, remove the timing chip from your ankle and drop it in the collection bins.

RESTROOMS: Restrooms are located to the left of the main entrance to the Boathouse.

RESULTS: Results will be posted on the NYT web site www.NYTRI.org. (Sunday afternoon).

PARKING: Central Park is closed to all vehicular traffic on weekends. Parking can be found outside the Park on the East and West Sides. The closest Park entrance to the start of the race is at 72nd Street and 5th Avenue.

Registration: http://nytc.org/calender.cfm

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
