results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.name: Krav Maga Level One

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?
We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

aAt the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON NYC

results.description:
Baladi Beat Belly Dance resumes its weekly dance class in Jersey City with Tarik Sultan.

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

Classes start this Monday 8:00pm to 9:00pm

$20 a single class, $45 for 3 classes, $60 for 4.

Cash or check made out to "Tarik Sultan".  To find out more about Tarik visit www.tariksultan.net/Class_Schedule.html

For more information call[masked]

results.description:
This will be a very special Side Ponytail. It will be the last Side Ponytail before creator and producer, Carolyn Busa, turns...oh no, 30! Come celebrate as she says goodbye to all things twenties. She'll be celebrating the night away with comedians and friends:

Mike Lebovitz (Last Comic Standing)
Emily Winter (Fusion, BackFat)
Lauren Vino (MTV News)
Lance Weiss (Gandhi Is That You?)
Tom Cassidy (Center City Comedy)
Samantha Ruddy (Laugh Your Asheville Off Fest)
Jim Ginty (Helium Comedy Club)
hosted by Carolyn Busa (Bridgetown Comedy Fest)

Side Ponytail is every 2nd Monday at Over the Eight (594 Union Ave, Brooklyn) and features NYC's funniest (and nicest!) comedians!

Look! Side Ponytail was featured in TimeOutNY as one of the best comedy shows: http://www.timeout.com/newyork/comedy/the-best-nyc-comedy-shows-run-by-female-comedians
results.name: Side Ponytail - FREE Comedy Show (Bye Bye Twenties Edition!)

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, have the day off, or just coming from work...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play. A tennis pro will also be on-hand.


Note: it may be necessary to move people around to keep it interesting or match people with like skills.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

ATTENDANCE

Unable to attend or need to change the day? If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show.  I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
If you've always wanted to try Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu or MMA, this is the perfect class for you!  Instructors are experienced and attentive.

We'll start the class with warm up drills, followed by technique and end with live sparring. Stop by for some great training with friendly people! All levels welcome! 

Bring your gi if you have one.  If not, we have extras to lend.  Please arrive 10 minutes prior to class.

For more info about the academy and it's instructors:

http://www.abreceabjj.com 

Don't hesitate to inquire if you have any questions!

results.description:
This event is posted on the First Time Upper West Side Moms meet up group (  http://www.meetup.com/Upper-West-Side-Moms/ ), but since it is for working moms, I am also posting it here. 

Come meet up with mothers who work in a baby-free environment.  Mothers-to-be, mothers on maternity leave, and all those wishing to discuss the challenges of work-life balance are also invited.  We will meet on the second Monday of every month.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the Piano Lounge.

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)
results.name: Monday 8:15pm Tron Ball - Night Soccer @ LIC (7v7 game) for PS2G

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

http://www.nyurban.com/basketball/open_play_bb.html

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
This week we will be learning the Samba and focusing on different kinds of timings there are in Samba! The focus will be learning different step variations with different rhythms to pinpoint just how rhythmical you have to be in Samba (and dancing overall).

We will be meeting in the Flamenco room on the left hand side. Wear comfortable sneakers or shoes and sweatpants or yoga pants are best as attire. Classes are $15 per person or $20 if you come as a couple. 

Looking forward to seeing all the dancers this week!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.

We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
Register Now  


Tuesday, October 13, 2015, 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM Eastern Time (US & Canada)

Going Paperfree -- Automating Your Back-end Processes

The arguments for keeping electronic records to save office space, improve findability and reduce waste are well rehearsed, and yet billions of unnecessary paper copies are still printed around the world every day. Meanwhile, we have moved on to another battlefront – paper-free processes.

AIIM Paper-Wars Industry Watch found:

44% of organizations are only 10% towards their goal of paper-free processes.Legal and finance departments are considered to be the most resistant to paper-free working.60% of users have seen ROI on their paper-free projects within 12 months, and an impressive 77% within 18 months. 

AIIM Seminars will help you to identify progress towards paper-free processes, the triggers and decision-making processes, and the issues, benefits and ROI. 

Register today!

Register Now
results.name: AIIM Seminar - Going Paperfree - Automating Your Back-end Processes

In an increasingly connected world, many enterprise IT infrastructures are strained by the demand to support floods of data from applications and cloud technologies, and also challenged by the growing demands to be more agile and operationally efficient. The promise of Software Defined Infrastructure is becoming real so how can an enterprise adapt quickly to this evolving digital environment?  

From designing, optimizing and operating the next generation digital infrastructure to exploring market trends, solutions, and strategies to capitalize on the BYOD and Enterprise Mobility Market, the Enterprise Development Workshops offer attendees a competitive advantage by hearing from and engaging with industry experts on how to leverage innovative technologies and embrace the connected world.

The workshop convenes enterprise and industrial application developers, IT experts, system architects, and industry influencers for a day of interactive and innovative sessions. Breakfast and lunch will be served with coffee and refreshments provided throughout the day. A Networking Reception will conclude the evening, where attendees will have the opportunity to demo cutting-edge enterprise solutions and mingle with speakers and guests over a glass of beer or wine.

PLEASE REGISTER ON THE

MAIN EVENT SITE

results.description:
Hi folks
This coming Tuesday morning, we have the pleasure of having Rob Reid coming by and sharing his journey and insights!

Rob Reid is a high technology entrepreneur and bestselling author based in both Los Angeles and San Francisco, California. A former venture capitalist, he was the founder, CEO, and later Chairman of Listen.com, which created & developed Rhapsody – the first online music service to secure full-catalog licenses from all of the major labels.


Rob has worked with technology startups as an investor, board member, and formal advisor for over ten years. Companies in his portfolio have included IGN, Kareo, WeHeartIt, and Surf Air.


Rob majored in International Relationships at Stanford, later earned an MBA Harvard Business School, and was also a Fulbright Scholar in Cairo, Egypt. He is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, and his books are published by Random House. His most recent novel (Year Zero) was a New York Times bestseller. It tells the story of a vast alien civilization which inadvertently bankrupts the entire universe by way of its unhealthy obsession with American pop music.

We'll get a chance to hear about all his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Tuesday!
results.name: NY Tech Week - Rob Reid (Rhapsody/Listen.com)

results.description:
Hey Golfers,

The Managing Director for the NFL Alumni Association has asked for some volunteers for a charity Golf event that they're having.  She needs 10 volunteers in total.  Hopefully a few of you can sign up for this as i'm sure this will be a memorable event.  If you are interested, please feel free to sign up here.  

This tournament will benefit both the NFL Alumni Association as well as the Independence Fund all while celebrating the 25th Anniversary of the 1990 New York Giants Super Bowl XXV Championship.  Each volunteer will receive an NFLA shirt as well as lunch on course, and a staff dinner.  They each will be paired with a fivesome that will include a member from the 1990 Super Bowl XXV Championship roster as the celebrity captain.  General information on the tournament is listed below: 5th Annual Hackensack Celebrity Golf Classic. Celebrating the 25th Anniversary of the 1990 Super Bowl Champions, NY Giants.  Celebrities scheduled to attend: Lawrence Taylor, OJ Anderson, Carl Banks, Stephen Baker, and many more NY Giants!  Benefits: Independence Fund & NFL Alumni Caring For Kids Independence Fund-  

The Independence Fund , Inc. was created in 2007 to assist severely injured Veterans in obtaining tools, therapies, and equipment they were not otherwise receiving from governmental agencies, especially in relation to mobility and quality of life.The NFL Alumni’s mission is to serve, assist, and inform our members to enrich their post- NFL lives. We care for kids and for our own, enabling our members to connect with each other and contribute to the community through charitable programs.

What you will you be volunteering for:  registration, scorekeeping for an assigned group, assisting with contests, etc.
results.name: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED for NFL ALUMNI ASSOCIATION Charity Golf Tournament

results.description:
Every Tuesday the CHA will meet at 12pm at the NY Hilton hotel. The Cannabis and Hemp Association can only accept CHA Affiliates who RSVP to the event. If you wish to attend a Meetup and bring a friend, they must become a CHA Affiliate. Your friend's or collegues may become an affiliate by joining the group www.meetup.com/cannabisandhemp . Here the CHA will discuss membership benefits, offer free consultations to anyone interested in the cannabis industry, and have an open forum to discuss future Meetups and CHA monthly events.

At the Meetup, the CHA often provides written materials for the lecture. Only those who RSVP will receive a copy of the meeting notes. Our materials are distributed based on those who have RSVP'd only.

Cannabis and Hemp TV is an online video blog where specific topics in  the cannabis industry are discussed, analyzed, and broken down amongst a panel.  All observers are welcome. Please RSVP and unRSVP if you cannot attend.

The NY Hilton is free to all members of the group and members are encouraged to bring friends, business ideas, business cards, and anything they would like to discuss about all things cannabis.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
